It would be funny, if it were not so sad. This list and a shinsa  
should be a serious opportunity for learning. I hope that people can  
learn from a shinsa. I also encourage everyone to ask questions.  
There were too few people who picked up their pieces and did not ask  
for an explanation. Next time, if there is one for you, ask the guy  
taking your money to call me over. I will be happy, or not, to  
explain anything you want to know. That is why we are doing a shinsa.  
Not to make you feel bad, but to try and share some knowledge with  
you. If I was hard on Ted, I am sorry. If Ted would like to contact  
me off line, I would be happy to help him understand his results. We  
are doing another shinsa in Chicago next April. Please use this  
opportunity to learn. Also, if anyone would like to volunteer to help  
out along with Milt, let me know and you can share in the process.

Gordon

On Sep 7, 2006, at 11:46 AM, nihontochicken wrote:

> --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Ron Hartmann" <swords@...>  
> wrote:
> > Anyone got anything to report on the sword show and shinsa that took
> > place this past weekend???
>
> Yeah, the judges were entirely unreasonable and were pinking juyo
> quality swords. Or so I hear. Hahahahaha! Sorry, just stirring it
> up for my own warped amusement. And, anyway, Kurt and Milt made me  
> do it.
>
> NC ;o)
>
>
>
